about.formula_en:
MFIS:

  • Total = Physical + Cognitive + Psychosocial
  • Physical Subscale: Items 4+6+7+10+13+14+17+20+21.
  • Cognitive Subscale: Items 1+2+3+5+11+12+15+16+18+19.
  • Psychosocial Subscale: Items 8+9
about.more_info_en: The shortened version of the MFIS uses questions 1, 9, 10, 17, and 19 from the longer version of the MFIS.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Fisk JD, Pontefract A, Ritvo PG, Archibald CJ, Murray TJ. The impact of fatigue on patients with multiple sclerosis. Can J Neurol Sci. 1994 Feb;21(1):9-14.

Validation.text: Tellez N et al. Does the Modified Fatigue Impact Scale offer a more comprehensive assessment of fatigue in MS? Mult Scler 2005;11(2):198– 202

Other References.text: Larson RD. Psychometric Properties of the Modified Fatigue Impact Scale.International Journal of MS Care. 2013;15(1):15-20. doi:10.7224/1537-2073.2012-019.
Freal JE, Kraft GH, Coryell JK.Symptomatic fatigue in multiple sclerosis.Arch Phys Med Rehabil. 1984 Mar;65(3):135-8.
Kos D, Nagels G, D'Hooghe MB, Duportail M, Kerckhofs E. A rapid screening tool for fatigue impact in multiple sclerosis. BMC Neurology. 2006;6:27. doi:10.1186/1471-2377-6-27.

creator_info.about_en: John Fisk, MD, is an associate professor of psychiatry in the Department Psychology and Neuroscience at Dalhousie University in Canada. He is also the chair of the Clinical and Population Health Research Review Committee of the MS Society of Canada. Dr. Fisk’s research focuses on the epidemiology, cognitive symptoms and health-related quality of life issues in neurodegenerative diseases including multiple sclerosis, dementia, systemic lupus erythematosus and Parkinson’s disease.

how_to_use.use_case_en: Quantifying the impact of fatigue on daily functioning in patients with Multiple Sclerosis.

next_steps.advice_en: The tool is useful for longitudinal tracking of a patient's MS-associated fatigue, but can also be used to measure severity of fatigue.
